ingredient_2: 4 tbsp vegetarian korma or Madras curry paste
method_1: Simmer the onion and the curry paste with a splash of water for 5 mins...
method_2: Heat the milk in a jug in the microwave
method_3: Add the vegetables and quinoa, then stir in the milk
method_4: Bring to the boil, simmer gently for 10 mins until the quinoa is cooke...

ingredient_4: 2 large Carrots, quartered lengthways and cut into chunks
method_2: Heat the oil in a casserole and brown the lamb on all sides
method_3: Scoop the lamb out onto a plate, then add the onion and carrots and cook for 2-3 mins until golden.
method_4: Add the garlic and cook for 1 min more. Stir in the spices and tomatoes, and season.
method_5: Tip the lamb back in with the chickpeas and apricots. Pour over the stock, stir and bring to a simmer. Cover the dish and place in the oven for 1 hr.
method_6: If the lamb is still a little tough, give it 20 mins more until tender
method_7: When ready, leave it to rest so it’s not piping hot, then serve scattered with pomegranate and herbs, with couscous or rice alongside.

ingredient_1: 350g thin-cut minute steak  , very thinly sliced into strips
ingredient_2: 3 tbsp cornflour, 2 tsp Chinese five-spice powder, 100ml vegetable oil
ingredient_3: 1 red pepper, thinly sliced, 1 red chilli, thinly sliced
ingredient_4: 4 spring onions  , sliced, green and white parts separated
ingredient_5: 2 garlic cloves, crushed, thumb-sized piece ginger  , cut into matchsticks
ingredient_6: 4 tbsp rice wine vinegar or white wine vinegar
ingredient_7: 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sweet chilli sauce
ingredient_9: cooked noodles, to serve (optional), prawn   crackers, to serve (optional)
method_1: Put 350g thin-cut minute steak strips in a bowl and toss in 3 tbsp cornflour and 2 tsp Chinese five-spice powder.
method_2: Heat 100ml vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan until hot, then add the beef and fry until golden and crisp.
method_3: Scoop out the beef and drain on kitchen paper. Pour away all but 1 tbsp oil.
method_4: Add 1 thinly sliced red pepper, ½ thinly sliced red chilli, sliced white ends of 4 spring onions, 2 crushed garlic cloves and thumb-sized piece ginger, cut into matchsticks, to the pan. Stir-fry for 3 mins to soften, but don’t let the garlic and ginger burn.
method_5: Mix the 4 tbsp rice wine vinegar or white wine vinegar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sweet chilli sauce and 2 tbsp tomato ketchup in a jug with 2 tbsp water, then pour over the veg.
method_6: Bubble for 2 mins, then add the beef back to the pan and toss well to coat.
method_7: Serve the beef on noodles with prawn crackers, if you like, scattered with the remaining ½ sliced red chilli and sliced green parts of the spring onions.
